newsitem.title: USA: Vivus says MUSE safe and effective in tests.
newsitem.headline: Vivus says MUSE safe and effective in tests.

text.p: VIVUS Inc said Wednesday results from European trials show its MUSE product, used to treat erectile dysfunction in men, showed the urethral suppository was safe and effective.
Results from the double-blind, placebo-controlled multicenter trial in Europe of MUSE were presented Tuesday at the European Association of Urology (EAU) meeting in Paris.
"Our European findings confirm the safety, efficacy and quality-of-life results seen in the trials we conducted in the United States," Neil Gesundheit, M.D., vice president, said.

"MUSE, also known as alprostadil, was well tolerated and facilitated the resumption of sexual intercourse in the majority of men with chronic erectile dysfunction across all etiologies studied," he added.
MUSE is a small, single-use, disposable applicator containing alprostadil, a synthetic version of the naturally occurring vasodilator prostaglandin E1.
